Package usecases.usermanagement

Interface UserDatabaseAccess

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SQLiteUserDatabase
    public interface UserDatabaseAccess
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.io.Closeable
    Gives methods that allow objects interfacing to interact with the user database. Allows objects that implement to access and edit the users in the database, as well as changing statistics of users on the database.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface Description
      static class  UserDatabaseAccess.InvalidStatisticError
      An exception representing the event where a provided statistic is invalid.
      static class  UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
      An exception representing the event where a given username is not found.

      • getAllUsernames

        java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllUsernames()
        Return a set of all usernames in this user database
        Returns:
        all the usernames stored

      • addUser

        boolean addUser​(java.lang.String username)
        Add a user to this database.
        Parameters:
        username - the user's username
        Returns:
        true if a new user was created (user did not previously exist), false otherwise

      • userExists

        boolean userExists​(java.lang.String username)
        Return whether a user with the given username exists.
        Parameters:
        username - check for the existence of this username
        Returns:
        whether a user with the given username exists

      • removeUser

        void removeUser​(java.lang.String username)
         throws UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
        Remove a user from this database
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to remove
        Throws:
        UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException - if the user to remove was not found

      • setUserStatistics

        void setUserStatistics​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> statistics)
                throws UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
        Set the specified statistics to the given amount for the given user.

        Implementations must support the following statistics:

        • gamesPlayed
        • gamesWon
        • gamesTied
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to set statistics for
        statistics - the new values of the statistics. Should be a mapping of {statistic: new value}.
        Throws:
        UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException - if the user to set statistics for was not found

      • addUserStatistics

        void addUserStatistics​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> statistics)
                throws UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
        Increment the specified statistics by the given amount for the given user.

        Implementations must support the following statistics:

        • gamesPlayed
        • gamesWon
        • gamesTied
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to add statistics to
        statistics - the statistics to add. Should be a mapping of {statistic: increment}.
        Throws:
        UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException - if the user to add statistics to was not found

      • addUserStatistics

        void addUserStatistics​(java.lang.String username,
                       java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> statistics)
                throws UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
        Increment the specified statistics by 1 for the given user.

        Implementations must support the following statistics:

        • gamesPlayed
        • gamesWon
        • gamesTied
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to add statistics to
        statistics - the statistics to add. Should be a mapping of {statistic: increment}.
        Throws:
        UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException - if the user to add statistics to was not found

      • getUserStatistics

        java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> getUserStatistics​(java.lang.String username,
                                                                              java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> statistics)
                                                                       throws UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
        Return the selected statistics for the given user.

        Implementations must support the following statistics:

        • gamesPlayed
        • gamesWon
        • gamesTied
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to retrieve statistics for
        statistics - the statistics to retrieve
        Returns:
        a mapping of statistic {name: value}.
        Throws:
        UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException - if the user to add statistics to was not found

      • getUserStatistics

                                                                       throws UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException
        Return all the statistics for the given user.
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the user to retrieve statistics for
        Returns:
        a mapping of statistic {name: value}.
        Throws:
        UserDatabaseAccess.UserNotFoundException - if the user to add statistics to was not found
